content: Just checking in from Minnesota to say "hi" to any Backdroppers out there today!

I don't have a night in mind yet, but was thinking about doing a Backdrop virtual game night one of these days. Had been looking forward to meeting a few people during an informal evening at nten before everything got cancelled - maybe we can get a few people who want to play Settlers of Catan virtually and chat.
@Laryn -I'd be interested. Two questions: 1) What is your time zone? 2) Have you experimented with the technology yet? How does it work?
I am pretty sure that @jenlampton would be on board for this...
FYI - I love board games, but haven't tried any of the online options yet.

there's also the online clone of Cards Against Humanity http://playingcards.io/game/remote-insensitivity

Play Remote Insensitivity online on PlayingCards.io
Play Remote Insensitivity online with your friends, for free

Hey guys :wave: :heart: ...wow! ...these 2 past weeks must have been the longest I've been absent from Backdrop, and the least I have contributed to open source in something like a decade+ :sweat_smile:
...I'm well (for those that have been concerned), but have been burned out by work ...been doing GovCMS documentation out of hours (at my request). Good distraction, but I miss my happy place.
...there's like 230+ comments to catch up with here, and I haven't gone through the issue queue yet. It's gonna be a fun Sunday :slight_smile:
I'm in for board games!! :tada: ...my collection has been gathering dust in Greece, ever since I moved to Melbourne. I get a sad face each time I pass by the book shelf.
...never tried the online versions of anything either.
@klonos - It's great to hear from you and know that your ok. :-)
Yup, slowly trying to get my "mojo" back :sweat_smile: ...I missed you guys.
